intro: Calotis glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are often covered in fine, glandular hairs, which give it its common name. Calotis glandulosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
